net.ssehub.comani.utility

Class ProcessUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.ssehub.comani.utility.ProcessUtilities

  • public class ProcessUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides utility methods for executing commands as external Process and returning corresponding ProcessUtilities.ExecutionResults.
    Author:
    Christian Kroeher

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ProcessUtilities.ExecutionResult
      This class provides the results of the execution of a command via executeCommand(String[], File).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ProcessUtilities.ExecutionResult executeCommand(java.lang.String[] command, java.io.File workingDirectory)
      Executes the given command as a Process in the current Runtime.
      java.lang.String[] extendCommand(java.lang.String[] command, java.lang.String commandElement)
      Returns an extended array by appending the given element at the end of the given array.
      java.lang.String getCommandString(java.lang.String[] command)
      Returns a single string consisting of the elements of the given array in ascending order of their index separated by a single whitespace.

      Returns the single instance of the ProcessUtilities.

      Reads the data from the given InputStream and returns it as a String.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ProcessUtilities getInstance()
        Returns the single instance of the ProcessUtilities.
        Returns:
        the single instance of the ProcessUtilities

      • executeCommand

        public ProcessUtilities.ExecutionResult executeCommand(java.lang.String[] command,
                                                       java.io.File workingDirectory)
        Executes the given command as a Process in the current Runtime.
        Parameters:
        command - the command that shall be executed; should never be empty or null itself as well as any of its elements
        workingDirectory - the working directory of the process created by this method for executing the given command; can be null if the process should use the directory in which the tool is executed
        Returns:
        the ProcessUtilities.ExecutionResult of the process executing the given command; never null

      • readStream

        public java.lang.String readStream(java.io.InputStream stream)
        Reads the data from the given InputStream and returns it as a String.
        Parameters:
        stream - the stream from which the data shall be read
        Returns:
        the String-representation of the stream's data

      • extendCommand

        public java.lang.String[] extendCommand(java.lang.String[] command,
                                        java.lang.String commandElement)
        Returns an extended array by appending the given element at the end of the given array. This method is, in particular, useful, if a command has to be executed via executeCommand(String[], File), which consists of multiple parts that have to be combined dynamically, e.g., at runtime.
        Parameters:
        command - the array to extend
        commandElement - the element to be added at the end of array
        Returns:
        a new array, which consists of the given array extended by the given element

      • getCommandString

        public java.lang.String getCommandString(java.lang.String[] command)
        Returns a single string consisting of the elements of the given array in ascending order of their index separated by a single whitespace. This method is, in particular, useful, if a command executed via executeCommand(String[], File) has to be logged or printed.
        Parameters:
        command - the array providing the elements for concatenation of a single string
        Returns:
        a single string consisting of the elements of the given array separated by whitespaces or null, if the array is null or empty
